Posts.Content: Thanks guys for all of the support a Nd wisdom I have found on here since first finding PSA was elevated.
Posts.Title: Post surgery report

Posts.Content: I went back to the dr. today for post-up appt. I was able to get all staples removed, CATHETER is out, and got told that all cancer was contained to the prostate. I updated my stats below. I am looking forward to all O's in a few months when my PSA is rechecked. I feel awesome.
Posts.Signature: DOB 1974 Diagnosed at 42, PSA Elevated at 41 No Signs, No Symptoms, found through work required physical for F.D. (THANK YOU DR. HUBBARD!!!!!!!!!) Physical exam normal First PSA 10/15 4.2, (antibiotics for 30 days suspected UTI, or prostate infection) Second PSA 12/15 3.7 Third PSA 05/16 4.1 05/16 Off to Urologist, Physical exam normal, wants to biopsy, do not like DR. 06/16 Second Urologist Physical exam normal, wants to MRI, then biopsy 07/16 Rectal probe MRI (MRI clear no abnormalities) 08/12/16 Biopsy 12 core sample 08/19/16 Biopsy results 6 of 12 Samples positive for cancer all Gleason 6 (3+3) with less than 5%-35% involvement per sample Da-Vinci scheduled for 10/18/2016 Pathology post op 8/26/2016 Gleason score upgraded to 7 (3+4) Weight 44 grams 15% total involvement Primary tumor +pT2c No evidence of extracapsular tumor extension Seminal vesicles Negative for tumor Surgical margins neagtive for tumor

Posts.Title: Post surgery report

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for all of the support a Nd wisdom I have found on here since first finding PSA was elevated.
Posts.Title: Post surgery report

Posts.Content: I was 41, when my PSA was found to be elevated (3.5-4.1) over the course of about 6-8 months. My Dr. treated me for infections, my physical exams were normal, after the 3rd. elevated test I went on my own to a urologist. Physical exam normal, no signs/symptoms. He recommended a biopsy, I pushed for the MRI, he didn't think insurance would cover it but it did. (and worth a try to check, have your urologist send the insurance paperwork). My MRI was clear but I still wanted to know if something was going on. I pushed to have the biopsy done and cancer was found in 5/12 samples. It was very early and I chose surgery last October. I had no problems with the biopsy, or surgery. I get the results of my second post op PSA tomorrow. I recovered fairly quickly from the incontinence, I still have ED but I am confident things will get back to normal one day. My advice is don't bet on the odds, yes, you are young but it does happen to younger guys. Push for the MRI, and follow up with the biopsy. For me it was the only piece of mind I could get, and I am glad I did.

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I was 41  when my PSA was found

Posts.Title: Prostate biopsy at 32

Posts.Title: Prostate biopsy at 32

Posts.Content: I had a rectal coil MRI in July. The bill was $6,200. I don't know if the one I had is also called the 3T MRI that is discussed on here frequently or not. My urologist thinks in a few more years, where I am at in US (southeast) it will become the first step after elevated PSA is detected. Fortunately my MRI was "clear" however the biopsy proved that they are still necessary.
Posts.Title: Is it time to make MRI screening for prostate cancer a reality?

Posts.Content: I had a rectal coil MRI in July. The bill was $6,200. I don't know if the one I had is also called the 3T MRI that is discussed on here frequently or not. My urologist thinks in a few more years, where I am at in US (southeast) it will become the first step after elevated PSA is detected. Fortunately my MRI was "clear" however the biopsy proved that they are still necessary.
Posts.Title: Is it time to make MRI screening for prostate cancer a reality?

Posts.Content: Mine was like flipping a light switch for each step. A week or so in diapers, poof, I drop back to pads for a month or so. Poof, I wear shields for a month or so, poof, nothing but the occasional dribble or squirt when I cough, pick up something, etc.. Now I am as dry as I was before surgery. While I was leaking it worried me thinking this may be life. I got so raw I could hardly walk some days.
Posts.Title: Freaking over post-op incontinence! Please tell me this gets better!

Posts.Content: I truly was hoping for an enlarged prostate diagnosis. Unfortunately he said it was normal sized. My biopsy is scheduled for June 6 until then I am scouring around for as much information as I can find, just in case. I didn't even know what the prostate did before last Friday.

Posts.Content: Thanks for the information guys, I am Winston Salem, NC. I have Wake Forrest Baptist Medical Center, Forsyth hospital, 10 minutes away. Duke and Chapel Hill about 1 1/2 hrs. And Charlotte is about an hour. I am blessed in the availability of services. How do you go about sorting through all of dr's available? I would really like to get it right the first time and not find it 2 yrs. later after the 3rd. biopsy.
Posts.Title: Biopsy questions???

Posts.Content: That is awesome to hear, I go back on Wednesday and I am hoping for the same news.
Posts.Title: Post Op Pathology

Posts.Content: First post here, I have been lurking for a week. I have lots of questions. First, I turned 42, 3 weeks ago. October 2015 during a routine physical my PSA came in at 4.4, DRE was normal. He put me on antibiotics for a month. Dec. 15, PSA was 3.7, he had me come back in 90 days, first of May PSA was 4.1, at this point I told him I was going to see a urologist. So, I go see last Friday, DRE normal and he wants to do a biopsy. I agree leave his office and spend 2 days reading, searching, and studying every thing I can find that will show up in a Google search. My doctor does not offer the guided/targeted MRI. Am I understanding correctly that this procedure produces more accurate results over the random core sampling? Or do they only do the MRI targeting after a positive finding? I have read and talked to a few guys who have 2-3 biopsys before they hit the right spot. I would rather have it done once and get the best and quickest results the first time instead of waiting. Should I, or could I ask to find someone who does the MRI biopsy or process with my doctor and let him do what he has planned.
Posts.Title: Biopsy questions???

Posts.Title: New here, just had DaVinci, day 2

Posts.Content: Mine was weak ago today, my abs were sore but not like I expected them to be. I didn't have to sleep in a recliner but one night and that was precautionary. The abd. pains/cramping from the gas, for me was awful. It lasted one full night and I didn't sleep a wink. Other than that it has by no means be a pleasure, but it hasn't been as bad as I had expected. I go tomorrow and hopefully get the catheter out, and staples. Keep plenty of lube/Neosporin around and use it alot. Good luck hopefully you get great news in a week or so
Posts.Title: Had my ORP yesterday...

Posts.Content: Mine was weak ago today, my abs were sore but not like I expected them to be. I didn't have to sleep in a recliner but one night and that was precautionary. The abd. pains/cramping from the gas, for me was awful. It lasted one full night and I didn't sleep a wink. Other than that it has by no means be a pleasure, but it hasn't been as bad as I had expected. I go tomorrow and hopefully get the catheter out, and staples. Keep plenty of lube/Neosporin around and use it alot. Good luck hopefully you get great news in a week or so
Posts.Title: Had my ORP yesterday...

Posts.Content: I am closing in on 9 months since surgery. I have ED, but I am hopeful things get back to normal I just turned 43. My incontinence clicked like a light bulb one day. First week after the catheter, I was wearing diapers, then one day I had some control. Changed to large pass for a few weeks and bam, one day I am dry, I dripped a little. Wore shields for a month or so and like a light switch. I was good, don't even have the dribbles when I cough or strain. Hang in there and do your kegals
Posts.Title: Just a short 4 month update

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by JJackson Best wishes for an uneventful surgery and speedy recover to Firemedic and toloh! Keep us posted folks. By your signature line, can one assume that everything functions as it did before the surgery?
Posts.Signature: DOB 1974 Diagnosed at 42, PSA Elevated at 41 No Signs, No Symptoms, found through work required physical for F.D. (THANK YOU DR. HUBBARD!!!!!!!!!) Physical exam normal First PSA 10/15 4.2, (antibiotics for 30 days suspected UTI, or prostate infection) Second PSA 12/15 3.7 Third PSA 05/16 4.1 05/16 Off to Urologist, Physical exam normal, wants to biopsy, do not like DR. 06/16 Second Urologist Physical exam normal, wants to MRI, then biopsy 07/16 Rectal probe MRI (MRI clear no abnormalities) 08/12/16 Biopsy 12 core sample 08/19/16 Biopsy results 6 of 12 Samples positive for cancer all Gleason 6 (3+3) with less than 5%-35% involvement per sample Da-Vinci scheduled for 10/18/2016 Pathology post op 8/26/2016 Gleason score upgraded to 7 (3+4) Weight 44 grams 15% total involvement Primary tumor +pT2c No evidence of extracapsular tumor extension Seminal vesicles Negative for tumor Surgical margins neagtive for tumor
Posts.Title: Robotic Surgery Tuesday 10-18-2016

Posts.Content: I am also scheduled for surgery tomorrow, I was supposed to have had it back on 9/27. The hospital called a week before and pushed it back due to scheduling conflicts. I am more than ready to get this thing out and to start recovering.

Posts.Content: Congratulations on your good report, I know what a relief it is to hear those words now. Now I have to go start on these levels. I have been leaking like a faucet since the cath came out.
Posts.Title: Post surgery doctor's report-

Posts.Content: So as you can in my signature line I had numerous samples come back positive. I am scheduled for surgery next month. I asked twice about a bone scan or PET scan and was told I don't need one. Do you see anything that says, I should push for a scan? I am scared of waking up from surgery and hearing bad news. I can't wait for the surgery to get here, so I can start healing and looking at this chapter in the rear view.
Posts.Signature: DOB 1974 Diagnosed at 42, PSA Elevated at 41 No Signs, No Symptoms, found through work required physical for F.D. (THANK YOU DR. HUBBARD!!!!!!!!!) Physical exam normal First PSA 10/15 4.2, (antibiotics for 30 days suspected UTI, or prostate infection) Second PSA 12/15 3.7 Third PSA 05/16 4.1 05/16 Off to Urologist, Physical exam normal, wants to biopsy, do not like DR. 06/16 Second Urologist Physical exam normal, wants to MRI, then biopsy 07/16 Rectal probe MRI (MRI clear no abnormalities) 08/12/16 Biopsy 12 core sample 08/19/16 Biopsy results 6 of 12 Samples positive for cancer all Gleason 6 (3+3) with less than 5%-35% involvement per sample Da-Vinci scheduled for 10/18/2016 Pathology post op 8/26/2016 Gleason score upgraded to 7 (3+4) Weight 44 grams 15% total involvement Primary tumor +pT2c No evidence of extracapsular tumor extension Seminal vesicles Negative for tumor Surgical margins neagtive for tumor
Posts.Title: Bone Scan ???

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, I am going back to see my Dr. on Monday for a sit down Q & A. I didn't let my wife go with me when I got the results of my biopsy. I had convinced myself I didn't have cancer. This time she is going so both of us can ask questions, now that we have processed the news.

Posts.Title: I am in the zero club!!!!!

Posts.Content: I have been off of the catheter 2 weeks this Wednesday. I do pretty good at night and while sitting also. When I am up walking around, the later in the day it gets the worse the leaking is. I feel like I have to go pee about every hour or so, I can't hold much volume. I am using about 3-4 shields a day.

Posts.Title: New Poster

Posts.Content: I am scheduled for September 27, that day can't get here fast enough. Please keep us informed of your progress.
Posts.Title: Checking in After Robotic Surgery

Posts.Content: It will be over before you know it, the recovery wasn't as bad as I had expected. The catheter is the hardest part, I used the leg bag and liked it alot better than all of the extra tubing swinging around looking for something to grab on to. I am 5 days removed from the catheter. I think each day I have seen an improvement on my leakage. It beats the alternative of having cancer growing in you. Good luck
Posts.Title: Surgery in 2 days

Posts.Content: I am scheduled for September 27, that day can't get here fast enough. Please keep us informed of your progress.
Posts.Title: Checking in After Robotic Surgery

Posts.Content: This makes my head spin. I was 41 when my PSA was found to be elevated. I have spent the last year preaching to friends, co-workers, even some strangers to get their PSA checked.

Posts.Title: Blood in urine??

Posts.Content: I am looking for just a jump in mine to get it back to the low normal. I don't need to 800-1000. Just looking for what is in the normal range. Your body is supposed to already be there.
Posts.Title: Testosterone after prostate cancer?

Posts.Content: I had prostate cancer surgery on October of 2016. Have had PSA of 0 on all follow up blood work. I have been having some issues lately with fatigue, low libido, no energy. I had my doctor check my testosterone levels and it was 238. I have an appointment scheduled for next week to discuss options. Everything I can find by searching says that there is no increase in PSA going up after testosterone treatment in former cancer patients. Does anyone have any experience in this? I want to feel better but I don't want to do anything detrimental to my health.
Posts.Signature: DOB 1974 Diagnosed at 42, PSA Elevated at 41 No Signs, No Symptoms, found through work required physical for F.D. (THANK YOU DR. HUBBARD!!!!!!!!!) Posts.Title: Testosterone after prostate cancer?

Posts.Content: So I posted on here a few months back about my elevated PSA. I have since had a rectal probe MRI, (completely normal and clear). I almost decided against the biopsy, but I figured I had been this far so why not. I got my results today. I turned 42 in April and have no family history, my PSA was found during a routine physical. My doctor checks every male over 40. 10/15 PSA 4.2 12/15 PSA 3.7 4/16 PSA 4.1 MRI 7/16 Biopsy 8/16 Diagnosis today 8/19 12 core sample, found cancer in 6 samples all scored Gleason 6 (3+3) samples range from less than 5% to 35%. My Urologist has suggested Davinci surgery as really the only option. I understand the Gleason of 6 is a favorable dx. I also believe a 3+3 is in my favor. How do they come up with the 3+3 as opposed to a 4+2? I am married and have a 9 y/o son. I have tons to live for and I believe my only option is surgery. I have scheduled my surgery for Sept. 27. Am I jumping the gun by doing it so fast? I am scared to death and want this done and over with, per my Dr. he has done 1000's of surgeries and he says not to worry, he is confident that I will be fine. Any advice is appreciated.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today, What do the number mean?

Posts.Content: My doctor was referred to me by a friend who had his surgery in May. I do like this guy, I saw another dr. initially but after talking with my buddy I changed practices. Dr. Craig Hall with UNC health systems. I know it sounds fast, but 6/12 slides and 5-35% involvement in each sample, is AS even an option? At my age he did not think radiation was the answer. He said my prostate is relatively small, does this help with nerve sparing? With this much involvement and samples is it remotely possible that the lab screwed this up?
Posts.Title: Diagnosed today, What do the number mean?

Posts.Content: I listed my numbers on my signature line and for a few posts, they appeared. Now I do not see them, what do I need to do to get them to reappear?
Posts.Title: How to List My Stats in Each of My Posts
